did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Consists of the correspondence, administrative files, author files, manuscript submission records and other miscellaneous documents pertaining to, but not limited to, fundraising, donors, publicity, prizes and awards of the literary publication.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Antioch Review was founded in 1940-1941 by a small group of Antioch College faculty who were seeking to establish an environment where "the voice of liberalism could be heard." In addition to exploring controversial and topical issues, the Review has always sought to provide a forum for new and emerging authors and poets as well as more established members of the literary community.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Author Files; II. Administrative Files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Author Files include contracts, correspondence, and original drafts of the stories and essays of various authors who have written for The Antioch Review, as well as copies of the final published versions of their work. Administrative Files include rejection letters to writers, correspondence pertaining to the business side of the publication, materials regarding the 50th anniversary of The Antioch Review, and two indexes covering sixty-five volumes.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Antioch Review mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
